comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

At least it wasn't a planned protest against employers violating workers rights or marching for women's rights. Only a nazi terror attack. No one will be held accountable. Fuck they are letting out people on house arrest that attempted to gouge out police eyes. Just wait for 2.0 next time they know they can go even further without worry of facing consequences. Every republican from now on will use this as a way to discredit them losing.
Motive has been established and is now documented. Lock them all up pending their trials. Their continuing obstruction is sufficient cause to take them off the streets ASAP.

> "....conservative legal ***scholar*** John Eastman"

Now now... let's not go crazy.
It's your fault that we attacked the Capitol by attempting a coup on January 6, 2021 ...
Eastman has been out saying that he was not REALLY involved. Uh huh.

>"The 'siege' is because YOU and your boss did not do what was necessary to allow this to be aired in a public way so that the American people can see for themselves what happened," Eastman replied, referring to Trump's false claims about the 2020 election being fraudulent.

Wasn't Eastman just trying to whitewash his involvement with the Eastman Memo just a few days ago?  Sorry, your reputation has turned to shit....much like others who have touched the orange toga.

The Chapman University School of Law must be so proud.

&#x200B;

/s
The Gang That Couldn't Think Straight.
Awesome, now when can we see some much needed high profile prosecutions and arrests?
